Name: Truncation of Security-relevant Information
Description: The product truncates the display, recording, or processing of security-relevant information in a way that can obscure the source or nature of an attack.
Common Consequences: ::SCOPE:Non-Repudiation:IMPACT:Hide Activities:NOTE:The source of an attack will be difficult or impossible to determine. This can allow attacks to the system to continue without notice.::
Observed Examples: ::REFERENCE:CVE-2005-0585:DESCRIPTION:Web browser truncates long sub-domains or paths, facilitating phishing.:LINK:https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2005-0585::REFERENCE:CVE-2004-2032:DESCRIPTION:Bypass URL filter via a long URL with a large number of trailing hex-encoded space characters.:LINK:https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2004-2032::REFERENCE:CVE-2003-0412:DESCRIPTION:application server does not log complete URI of a long request (truncation).:LINK:https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2003-0412::
